question: A 70-year-old man with hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus is admitted to the hospital 8 hours after the onset of impaired speech and right-sided weakness. Two days after admission, he becomes confused and is difficult to arouse. His pulse is 64/min and blood pressure is 166/96 mm Hg. Pulse oximetry on room air shows an oxygen saturation of 95%. Fundoscopic examination shows bilateral optic disc swelling. He is intubated and mechanically ventilated. A CT scan of the brain shows hypoattenuation in the territory of the left middle cerebral artery with surrounding edema and a 1-cm midline shift to the right. Which of the following interventions is most likely to result in a decrease in this patient's intracranial pressure?
options: B. Increase the fraction of inhaled oxygen
C. Increase the positive end-expiratory pressure
